description.narrative: (i) Construction of critical business infrastructure: The Project will add much-needed supply of international standard office, retail and hospitality infrastructure to Yangon. International standard business infrastructure such as these are of critical importance in attracting foreign investments in the country. (ii) Improvement of service standards: The Project will significantly improve the standards of office, retail and accommodation facilities and services available to travelers and the business community. (iii) Employment creation and knowledge transfer: The Project will create a significant number of direct and indirect employment opportunities for the local community both during construction and operational phases. It will also promote the transfer of service and management expertise and knowledge to the local staff. (iv) Benefits to the local economy and local linkages: The Project will help create demand for locally-sourced materials, services, and labor both during the construction and operation stages. The Project is expected to generate additional sales for local small and medium enterprises, including a wide range of goods and service providers. (v) Increase in tax revenues and foreign exchange: The Project is expected to contribute to the domestic economy through increased tax revenues and foreign exchange inflow, particularly as it is expected that a significant portion of the users (office, retail and apartment lessees and hotel guests) will be foreign nationals and that a significant amount of Project revenues is expected to be paid in foreign currency. (vi) Private sector development: The presence of this large scale development in Yangon will send a positive signal about investing in Myanmar, particularly to foreign investors.

Yoma Strategic Holdings Ltd. (Yoma) together with First Myanmar Investment Co., Ltd (FMI) will develop a mixed-use complex on a 10-acre site surrounding the 136 year-old building of the former headquarter of the British Burma Railway Company (the BBR Building) in downtown Yangon, Myanmar. The Project consists of the development of two office towers, a business hotel and a serviced apartment building, a branded residential building, a retail podium, car park, public spaces and underlying infrastructure. The redevelopment of the BBR Building will be undertaken separately to house a Peninsula branded hotel and is not part of the Project.

mailing-address.narrative: A bilingual English and Burmese language advertisement will be placed in a major local newspaper in Yangon to inform the public that the results from IFCs E&S due diligence are available for access. English and Burmese language SII will also be posted at conspicuous locations outside the main entrance of the Project site and at the front entrance of FMI Centre; and the same on Yomas corporate website or provide a web-link to IFCs disclosed SII.
JR Ching FMI Centre, Level 10 & 11 380 Bogyoke Aung San Road Pabedan Township Yangon, Myanmar Tel: +95 1 240363 Fax: +95 1 246881 http://www.yomastrategic.com

name.narrative: The Project site is located on Bogyoke Aung San Road, Pabedan Township, in central Yangon.

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.

title.narrative: Summary of Investment Information - Anticipated Impact Measurement & Monitoring (AIMM) Assessment and Main Environmental & Social Risks and Impacts of the Project
